definition[0]: to think about or discuss an idea before making a decision
example[0]: We kicked that suggestion around and in the end decided to go ahead.
definition[1]: to treat someone badly and unfairly
example[1]: I have my pride, you know. They can’t kick me around.
definition[2]: to be in a place doing things, but without any firm plans
example[2]: He kicked around India for a few months.
definition[3]: to be left in a place untidily or forgotten
example[3]: There’s a copy of the report kicking around somewhere.
